comment.text: The food and ambience was excellent! Everything we ordered was full of flavor. Can't wait to return!

Just WOW! This place ticks all the boxes for me. Setting is intimate with its low light. They have small, adjustable lamps at each table so you can still read your menu with ease, which I found thoughtful. 

The food was so good - we ordered the ceviche, shaking beef and lamb chops. The ceviche has the perfect amount of spice. The tarp chips were to die for! The shaking beef was tender and perfectly cooked - I loved the acidity of the salad which paired well with the steam. The lamb chops portioning was a bit disappointing but the flavor was amazing! Loved the ratatouille on the side. 

To finish off the night, we ordered the crème brûlée and I still am thinking about it. The best I've ever had! Their dessert menu was extensive and made it hard to decide, but I'm glad we got this because it far exceeded expectations. 

As I was leaving, an employee stopped me and gave me a rose they had leftover from Valentine's day. Totally made my night!!! Will definitely be coming back super soon.

Le Colonial is one of my favorite restaurants in Atlanta. The food is delicious, the ambiance is chill and upscale and the staff is amazing! 

I have been so many times now that I am only posting pictures from my first ever visit because I tend to order the same things once I like them.

I always have the spicy chicken stir fry, it's spicy, lemongrassy and delicious af. Comes with a cute side of rice; honestly my fav chicken stir fry in the city. 

For dessert, I get the pineapple upside cake. My God. It's amazing. To the point where I order it to go and still ask for the ice cream (I think coconut), knowing it will melt on the cake. 

The drinks!! I get this passion fruit one (white silk dress) and the cranberry-cucumber one (Poire Marguerite), both delicious. 

The staff!!! Keisha at the lounge bar is THE BEST! Marjorie and Alexis are the other amazing bartenders I've continually had GREAT service from. 

The lounge is first come first serve and there's a dj on Fridays and Saturdays. Shoutout to dj Grace always curating a vibe. 

Between the combination of delicious food, cute and upscale ambiance, amazing staff, this is my go to places, especially when folks visit from out of town.

photos.caption: Ao Lua Ha Dong / White Silk Dress
Ga Xao Xa Ot / Spicy Chicken Stir-Fry*

comment.text: Excellent upscale vietnamese food. Cocktails and service were impeccable. Overall worth trying.

I tried Le Colonial with one of my friends and we loved it so much that we ordered double of almost everything that we got. The ribs and tuna tartare were by far my favorite items on the menu. The lychee martini was probably the best I've had in Atlanta to date. Our waiter peeped my love for lychees and brought me a ton more for my second and third rounds. & if a menu has creme brûlée I will always try it, and Le Colonial's did not disappoint. We sat on the patio and got to see a beautiful view of the sunset. This is a great spot to go to with friends or even on a date. I am very excited to go back!

photos.caption: Cha Gio Chay / Crispy Vegetable Roll
Ca Song / Spicy Yellowfin Tuna Tartare
Cha Gio Chay,  Spicy Yellowfin Tuna Tartare, Baby Back Ribs, Pan Seared Chicken Dumplings
Ca Song / Spicy Yellowfin Tuna Tartare Sui Cao Chien / Pan Seared Chicken Dumplings Cha Gio Chay / Crispy Vegetable Roll
Ca Song / Spicy Yellowfin Tuna Tartare

comment.text: This is a great spot. A bit pricey but the food is really good! I've been here a couple times for lunches and dinners but the most recent time I came they had a lunch special that we checked out called Prixe Fixe. For my first course I got the SUI CAO CHIEN, second course was the GA XAO XA OT and for dessert I got the Lemon Tart. All three items were really great and I definitely recommend. It was light enough for lunch. I have also tried other items here and everything so far has been yummy!

photos.caption: Sui Cao Chien / Pan Seared Chicken Dumplings

comment.text: One of my top three restaurants to dine at in Buckhead.  Being a total foodie Who fines out on a regular basis, I'm all about the ambience, service, flavor, and over all experience. Le Colonial never disappoints. My favorite cocktails include the French Martini as well as the white silk dress. Both are packed with flavor and a taste that will knock you off your feet (lol) tonight was the first time I actually ordered an entree. I usually just order a ton of small plates. The spicy chicken soup OMG one of my favorite dishes, as well as the baby back ribs, chicken dumplings, and chicken and mushroom ravioli. I highly doubt anything on the menu will be a disappointment. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Le Colonial can be great for a date night or a fabulous dinner with the girls

I enjoyed the Food at Le Colonial before. It's good Vietnamese food on nicer plates and atmosphere. Service today was offensive. 

They have a dress code which is subjective at best. I was told I'm not up to code because I was wearing active (actually) dress pants. We were all nicely dressed. We had to call the manager to who said it was okay but obviously was not pleased at our complaints. 

Then, we were treated like second class citizens throughout the whole meal. Poor service, poor attitude, poor everything. I was given stained plates 3 times before I just relented and wiped the chili oil off the plate and just started eating because the meal was out and already getting cold. Not a mention of apology or acknowledgment that this is odd. Our server did not check on us throughout the whole meal. 

This was the tone of the whole meal. Offensive and vindictive for no reason. It was nauseating.
Great atmosphere, awesome ambience. The food is a blend of Asian flavor and French colonial twist as the name suggests. Cocktails are well crafted.

Food was ok and service was good but extremely overpriced in our opinion.
Ceviche app was $19 and very small portion.  Glass of (cheap) wine was $19 and pint of Stella was $10.
Better spots in ATl, would not recommend.

It was honestly okay, it wasn't the best. I feel like it's just a really bouge place with almost mediocre food. Like it wasn't the BEST but it definitely wasn't memorable either. The ambience was very dark, so I guess that's what restaurants classify as elegance these days lol?

Went for a birthday drink last week. We ordered two drinks and were charged $50. For one of the drinks we asked if one of their mock tails could be made into a cocktail - so they charged $11 for the mock tail AND an additional $18 to turn it into a cocktail... ie they charged $29 for one drink, more expense than any other cocktail on their menu. Absolutely absurd.

I haven't even gotten the food yet and I'm over it. I came here with an excited mood. Like my two friends and I were utterly excited and here we are.. I'm over it. 

Please note that I prefer to always give a positive review but here we are. The gentleman at the door greeted me with poor customer service. He mentioned that Hats weren't allowed. As I forgot to take the take off, this "greeter" came over extremely aggressive, raised his voice, was extremely embarrassing and disrespectful. No one combated him or talked back orrr said a word but he KEPT TALKING AND RAISING HIS VOICE. I SAID NOTHING!!!! With that said, I'm pissed and his lack of customer service will have me NEVER coming back to
This whack establishment.  Who wants to eat angry?!!Not me.  The customer service in general was basic. Let see what this food is about. (I ONLY stayed for my friends).

Pros - 
Valet Parking - very convenient
Very pretty inside - nice dining room and outdoor dining available
Good service - our server made very good recommendations and was very prompt with meeting our requests (except that he kinda disappeared at the end of the meal)
Nice size portions
Freshness - everything tasted very fresh; the green papaya salad was amazing
Garlic noodles - best side with lots of flavor

Cons - 
Over-salted - we found most of the food very salty
Over-cooked - Our ribs appetizer bordered on burnt and the spicy chicken stir-fry was very dry.
Dress Code - We had no problem with abiding by the rules but the gentleman in sweats and tennis shoes that rode the elevator with us, along with the restaurant's elevator escort, obviously didn't feel the rules applied to him (and neither did the restaurant).

This is definitely a new fave. You can't go wrong here. Every dish was well prepared. I had my heart set on the red snapper but the current market rate is $72. I was expecting to pay around $45 but I'm guessing the price increased during the pandemic or they must have flew that baby in fresh from the Caribbean lol. 
Some of the items I tried include; garlic noodles, crispy brussel sprouts, grilled japanese eggplant, and signature fried rice. All the dishes were amazing. Drinks to btw. 
The restaurant has an amazing lounge. The lounge hours are Monday-Saturday 5pm-7pm. $5 draft beers, $8 cocktails & wines, $8 bar bites. On Mondays the restaurant offers 1/2 off all bottles of wine under $100 both in the lounge & restaurant. Also, the restaurant does validate parking which gets you $3 off the cost of parking. According to the validation ticket you can send a text to request your vehicle and the valet will notify you when your car is ready.

The atmosphere is very bougie so don't show up under dressed. We sat in the back lounge area as it has a very cute hip vibe and they play music. The food was great, however entrees do not come with sides and you have to add as a la carte and it can get pricey. Its a great place to try.
The food is good but not spectacular. Price is not worth the quality and flavor of the food.
Absolutely delightful experience. The food was outstanding. The service was efficient and helpful. Everything was great. Strongly recommend

Omg amazing restaurant. Must try at least once. 

So amazing and tasty!! Loved the cocktails. First time I've ever asked for seconds :)

Buyer beware- they are insanely strict on dress code. I arrived straight from the airport, after my flight being canceled. We explained to the manager before I arrived that I was in black joggers. When I walked in the manager looked me up and down and told me there was no way I could sit. I have never been made to  feel so small in my entire life and I have eaten at some of the best restaurants in the world.

Enjoyed lunch at this Vietnamese French cuisine upscale restaurant in Buckhead. They offered a price fix menu for $25 which included an appetizer and entree. We had the shrimp roll then the salmon to share. Then we also added a papaya salad, side of green beans and the lemon dessert. Everything we had was delicious but I think I would do the chocolate mousse for dessert instead.

From attending the opening night party, to hosting private dinners with friends and colleagues to lovely date nights with my spouse at the bar, I've dined at Le Colonial more times than Open Table can keep track of. I can honestly say that every experience has been unique, noteworthy, and the best representation of French Vietnamese food in Atlanta. My favorites to start: a Lychee Martini and the Goi Con Chilled Shrimp Rolls paired with the Cari Tom Green Shrimp Curry a followed by a scoop of Pistachio Ice Cream. 

As a best practice when considering a fine dining restaurant, it is suggested to preview the menu and dress code before making your reservation. And if you find yourself in a last minute pickle without a reservation, you will be welcomed in with accommodating options by the generous staff.

photos.caption: Goi Con Shrimp Rolls,Ca Song / Spicy Yellowfin Tuna Tartare, Lychee Martini

comment.text:
This place was great 
we went back the second time 
I enjoy the atmosphere and the decorations

Food was good pricey the lychee martini was good but the drinks are insanely overpriced. The service was that of Chilis the waitress didn't even tell us her name so spiel no recs just drinks, order, check. For over 200 for two people I expect more. Not the mention the waitress STOLE FROM ME!!! She was left $50 cash on $200 and two days later I see she's also charged my card $40. After speaking with the manager and getting refunded he said it was an accident, anyone who's worked In service knows that impossible to accidentally enter a tip. There is way too many steps in the computer. Anyway I was offered a gift card as if I'd return. The $40 was refunded the next day after speaking on the phone but honestly this might be naive but I expected the whole check to be refunded after their staff literally stole from me. Wonder what happened to the waitress manager said nothing about repercussions just that "he felt bad".

Every time I go here I receive a 5 star experience. The food... the ambiance... the service.... Everything is top notch! They have the most amazing tuna tartare and that is always my go-to. I've also had the dumplings, grilled sesame beef rolled flat noodle & pork ribs for starters which were good as well. The seafood ceviche was mediocre to say the least. For main entrees I've tried the beef noodles, fried rice, spicy chicken stir-fry  & whole fried snapper all of which were amazing. As a side I always order brussel  sprouts. They are extremely strict on dress code. I was coming from a pedicure appointment last time I went for lunch and they almost didn't let me in. If it wasn't for the reservation I had made I do think they would have turned me away. My go-to drunk is the leeche martini but I've also had 2 of their specialty drinks one of which I can't recall the name that was super strong and the other one was dark liquor with an egg white topping. They have valet parking up front I believe it's $2-$5. But they also have a parking deck that is not free. Overall 5 stars.

photos.caption: Ca Song / Spicy Yellowfin Tuna Tartare & Suon Nuong / Glazed Pork Ribs

comment.text: This is my first time here but not my last.  The food is delicious. We came on a busy Friday night and didn't have reservations but after about 45 minutes and two Lychee martinis later and we were seated.  The food and drinks were delicious and the customer service was top notch.  I look forward to coming here again.

photos.caption: Tom Xao Sate / Spicy Shrimp Stir-Fry*

comment.text:
Came here the other night for dinner and was extremely impressed. 

The decor is beautiful and the service was impeccable. 

The tuna tartare appetizer was the star of the show! When I come back, I fully plan on ordering 2 of those as my entree lol. 

I also tried the duck and the sea bass. They were both decent, but I wasn't wowed. The flavors were delicious but restrained- too restrained for my liking. I expected to be smacked in the face with flavor and they were both just a bit lackluster. 

I will be back to try their food again, hopefully I will have an entree that is more aggressive in the flavor department.

While the cold spring rolls were a bit too firm, bland, and hard to chew, the rest of the food was excellent. The environment was the perfect mix of Atlanta fine dining and a fantasy version of French colonial Vietnam. Service was efficient and friendly. Overall a great experience.
An absolutely wonderful experience from decor and ambiance, to service and food. The curry chicken and crème brûlée was fabulous!

photos.caption: Tiramisu with Madeleines is to die for!

comment.text: I love this place. I've been a few times and have enjoyed my experience every time.  I recently when to try their pre-fix menu where we got an appetizer, main course and dessert.  For my appetizer i got the spring roll, which was refreshing and delicious.  I got the chicken stir fry for my main and it was so flavorful.  And for dessert i got the lemon tart which was the highlight of the meal!

photos.caption: Cha Gio / Crispy Shrimp & Pork Roll
Sui Cao Chien / Pan Seared Chicken Dumplings
Ga Xao Xa Ot / Spicy Chicken Stir-Fry*

comment.text: Unfortunately we had a bad experience, we got our appetizers and the waitress forgot to bring our main entree. After a long wait, we asked about our food and she apologized - she offered a complimentary dessert and said she would w check with the kitchen. A few moments later, she brought our food... the problem was that it had clearly been sitting out for awhile, and they just reheated it. Which dried out the meat and gave a bad flavor to our sides. This place did not live up to our expectations.

Enjoyed a great night at Le Colonial. One of the newest additions to the Shops of Buckhead, this restaurant specializes in French-Vietnamese cuisine in an upscale loungey environment. It feels like high end Florida hotels during the moonshine days with wicker chairs, tropical plants, and vibrant colors. It is located on the second level and accessible by stairs or elevator. 


Hands down service was amazing. Jennifer and her staff paid just the right amount of attention and were unobtrusive. I enjoyed a glass of Pinot noir, lettuce wraps, and Brussels. Also enjoyed the ahi tuna. Can't wait to return to try the duck and larger plates. 

Valet is available out front on the first level. Parking at the shops is validated for first three hours.

Previous review speaks volume. Manager or host is very selective of who they want to take in! Dress code is fine but work on restaurant hygiene first!
Racist, expensive, and dirty. They are only busy enforcing dress code when the focus should be else where. Very funny business!!
Very rude customer service. This place has a strict dress code and will deny entry even if you wear business casual and made a reservation. Will not come back.

Excellent service! Delicious food. Valet parking! We were celebrating my friend's bachelorette and they did such a good job in welcoming us and celebrating! The appetizers were great especially the potstickers/dumplings. The sides were outstanding! The garlic noodles and the green beans were my absolute favorite. Enjoyed our time!

Upscale Vietnamese restaurant that is WORTH the money. I love their vegetarian curry and lychee martinis.  You can't go wrong with any of their food options and it is always a great atmosphere. You definitely jerky need red stations if eating at night with a larger group. It is delicious and you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: TAU HU CARI / Spicy Organic Tofu Curry

comment.text: This place was amazing & I recommend it to everyone who asks for a great dinner spot in Atlanta. We had a reservation & went a bit early & ended up sitting in the lounge in the back, which we thought was beautiful!! We got seats at the bar, put our name in with the host for the lounge & were moved to a table after an hour & a half. the bar was comfortable though & we would have been happy to stay there but gave our bar seats to people waiting. The tequila drink was amazing! We got a few rounds just because it tasted so good. All of the food was amazing! Can't wait to go again.

photos.caption: Sui Cao Chien / Pan Seared Chicken Dumplings, Cha Gio Chay / Crispy Vegetable Roll
Crispy Brussel Sprouts, Com Chien / Signature Fried Rice*, Ga Xao Xa Ot / Spicy Chicken Stir-Fry*

comment.text: Love Le Colonial. It's one of my faves! Their Lychee Martinis are amazing. Food is super yummy. And the vibe is always fun. I have been for lunch and dinner many times. Never had a bad time. Service is always good.

I don't normally write reviews of lunch experiences because I find that it is difficult to gauge a restaurant for lunch. However for Le Colonial it definitely deserves one because (even though I wasn't terribly hungry) the decor, service, food and setting were absolutely off the chart! Interestingly enough I almost negated coming here because I have over the years never had a tasting for Vietnamese (although they term themselves French Vietnamese).

Located in Buckhead Village with other well known restaurant names (and I presume the Spanx headquarters) the area is beautiful. Taking the elevator to their upper floor location we were met by a beautiful dining room that was a Wow. We were asked at 12:00 pm if we had a reservation which was the only irritant for the overall experience but nonetheless were seated with no difficulty. 

Our server was Rudy who was an expert on all menu items and was extraordinarily helpful with suggestions. If I owned a restaurant Rudy would be the person I'd mirror (or try to steal) for my restaurant. Service was great.

All the food was consistently outstanding. Light, numerous flavors exploding in our mouths and just overall - what could I say? Just fantastic.

We had:

Chicken dumplings with their light dipping sauce - delicious.

Cha Gio Chay which were crispy vegetable "hot" rolls that came with lettuce and hot peppers with a light dipping sauce. Rudy told us to roll the vegetable roll in the lettuce and pepper (which I had not thought of and glad that he brought this up) which as I'm writing this I'm salivating over how good it was.

Followed up with Spicy Chicken Stir Fry which had a variety of great flavors - another highlight to the meal.

... And Shaking Beef - the most tender bite size morsels of filet mignon cooked perfectly with greens in a very light and modest  vinaigrette. Again a winner!

We added to our main courses - garlic noodles - which you say how good can noodles be? Well try this and you'll find out! Absolutely a must.

And Rau Xao - which was bok choy and broccoli - absolutely stupendous.

Overall this was our best dining experience in Atlanta and one of the best meals I've had in years!

Looking forward to them opening up in South Florida (Delray Beach) to be exact and to becoming a regular. 

This is a must try! And Highly Recommended.

photos.caption: Cha Gio Chay - Crispy (hot) vegetable rolls with lettuce and hot pepper - Amazing!
Spicy chicken stir fry - flavors were incroyable!
Shaking beef - bite size morsels of really tender filet mignon cooked perfectly served on greens
Rau Xao - Bok Choy and Broccoli - Again flavors amazing!
Garlic Noodles - How good could needed be? Try these and you'll find out

comment.text:
Been here several times in the past year and I always enjoyed their food as they have been excellent! Not sure what changed, but both food quality and service have gone down quite of bit. I don't believe in rating based on service. This 3-star rating is based on food only. If based on service, it would have been -1! 

I wouldn't say that you should avoid the place altogether. But I probably won't go back there again as I sense that they might be having some issues with staffing... too bad as I really loved this place!

5 star restaurant. Everything was amazing, from the service to the food & drinks. Loved the atmosphere and the server's recommendations and description of the food and drinks were on point! Started off with a Manhattan. Good amount of liquor and quite flavorful. Ordered the Coconut Chicken Soup. For only $10, it was more than enough to share and so flavorful. The best coconut soup that I have ever had! Plenty of chicken and mushrooms! Loved the mushrooms! I also tried the spring rolls and they were amazing! They're average size but full of meat and vegetables. Wrap them in lettuce & carrots and you're good to go. Would highly recommend this restaurant!

photos.caption: Coconut Sup Ga Cay / Spicy Chicken Soup

comment.text: It was alright. Nothing really wowed me. Food and cocktail menu very limited. I don't know if I want to come back. Although service was excellent
The device was good. The food was mediocre. I love the location and ambiance. The service was good.

photos.caption: The food is mediocre. I should have ordered the branzino.

comment.text: I love it here! It's always so nice and classy. Servers are great. Their lychee martini is to die for. Def recommend for a cute date night (:

Yum! I love the vibe here. I came twice, once late night for drinks and then today for food! The young lad who brought our dishes made some additional suggestions. He really knew his stuff! I wish I knew his name, I think Randall? Anyway he gave great service and had really detailed suggestions which were on par!

Atmosphere is sexy in there, great for a date or even drinks with friends!

Service was elite. Noah was great. He was courteous, attentive, and pleasant.  He was one of the best servers that we have had at any restaurant.  He made awesome recommendations as far as food and desserts, which were all great. Also the ambiance was great.

Le Colonial is one of my favorite places to visit in Atlanta. Starting with the private elevator to their amazing ambiance and food that never disappoints. They have an amazing happy hour staring lychee martinis and a very tasty pork and shrimp roll. I definitely recommend indulging in their coconut pineapple upside down cake to finish your experience. Le Colonial is always a 12/10 in my book!

photos.caption: Gyoza &  Bo Bia / Chilled Vegetable Roll
Cha Gio / Crispy Shrimp & Pork Roll Goi Cuon / Chilled Shrimp Roll

comment.text: I enjoyed this spot! I met a former coworker here for dinner. She is vegan and they had some options that worked for her. We sat in the back area by the bar and it was super nice / glitzy vibes. I got a blueberry mocktail that was quite yummy and the chicken soup which was also good. I found out afterwards that there is a location in Chicago where I live so I will probably go there when I am back in town!
Wonderful Vietnamese food. Excellent service. Very nice dining room. We'll definitely go again.

photos.caption: Pear gin fizz (I asked for normal gin, not pumpkin gin)

comment.text:
Made reservations....Went here for lunch, glad I did!
Almost didn't get let up at the elevator because the host said I wasn't dressed properly with flip flops on. He stated that the dress code is business casual and that my flip flops might be a problem. Turns out no one had an issue with them but him.

Anyway I ordered a French Martini cocktail that was delicious. I also order the Tuna Tartare as an appetizer, was a little spicy but tasted great. 
For lunch I went with the Atlantic Salmon, no complaints, very tasty. Ended my lunch with a Pineapple Coconut Cake topped with vanilla ice cream yummy!
